name: 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3893
Reason: The molecular structure of 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione contains a complex arrangement of functional groups, which affects its melting point. The dioxane ring, which has a melting point of around 120°C, is a significant contributor to the overall melting point. The methyl groups, which are relatively small and nonpolar, contribute to the rigidity of the molecule and increase the melting point. The phenyl group, which is polar and flexible, can disrupt the crystal lattice and lower the melting point. The furyl group, which is also polar and flexible, can also contribute to the melting point. The ester group, which is polar and flexible, can also disrupt the crystal lattice and lower the melting point. The overall effect of these functional groups is a complex interplay of increasing and decreasing the melting point.
